body_html:
My programs are working fine now. Only one change I am taking care of additionally is - (a) low learning rate
…
On Mon, May 29, 2017 at 10:46 AM, Abolfazl Meyarian < ***@***.***> wrote: I have cudnn 5.1 and cuda-8.0. cudnn is copied in cuda's directory. I've also appended it's path to the system PATHs as: C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v8.0\bin Also msvcp140.dll is included both in systemWow64 and system32 and I use Python 3.5.2. What is wrong? Have you faced the same problem? — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#9484 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AOK79WsXgcVHPCWfMXyUbdePlThtk7AEks5r-lSsgaJpZM4NKELT> .
-- Regards Rajeev

additionally is - (a) low learning rate

body:
My programs are working fine now. Only one change I am taking care of
additionally is - (a) low learning rate

On Mon, May 29, 2017 at 10:46 AM, Abolfazl Meyarian <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I have cudnn 5.1 and cuda-8.0. cudnn is copied in cuda's directory. I've
> also appended it's path to the system PATHs as:
>
> C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v8.0\bin
>
> Also msvcp140.dll is included both in systemWow64 and system32 and I use
> Python 3.5.2.
>
> What is wrong? Have you faced the same problem?
